Model¶

PROTEUS abstract class to be used as a superclass for both.

class proteus.model.abstract_object.AbstractObject(path)¶

A PROTEUS abstract object is an abstraction of PROTEUS projects and objects. It contains all features which are common to both types of PROTEUS objects, especially:

  1. Path to its XML file

  2. ID

  3. State

  4. Properties

  5. (and probably more in the future)

generate_xml() → Element¶

It generates an XML element from an abstract object. It must be overriden in subclasses.

Returns:

The XML element.

Return type:

ET.Element

generate_xml_properties(parent_element: Element) → Element¶

Generate xml property function. It generates an ET.Element from the properties of an abstract object (Object and Project).

Parameters:

parent_element – ET.Element. The parent element of the properties.

Returns:

The properties element.

Return type:

ET.Element

get_property(key: str) → Property¶

It returns an object’s property given its name. It aborts if there is no property with that name. TODO: return None in that case?

Parameters:

key – the name of the property to be returned.

Returns:

the property with the given name.

load_properties(root: Element) → None¶

It loads a PROTEUS abstract object’s properties from an XML root element.

Parameters:

root (ET.Element) – the XML root element.

set_property(new_property: Property) → None¶

It sets an abstract object’s (Object and Project) property.

Parameters:

new_property (Property) – the new property to be set.

class proteus.model.abstract_object.ProteusState(value)¶

Enumeration for abstract object’s state. An abstract object can be in one of the following states: #. FRESH: New object, just cloned but not already saved #. CLEAN: Loaded object, not modified #. DIRTY: Loaded object, modified #. DEAD: Loaded object, to be deleted

Proteus - Archetype Manager

class proteus.model.archetype_manager.ArchetypeManager¶

An utility class for managing PROTEUS archetypes. It must provide a way to get the project, document, and object archetypes on demand.

static clone_project(archetype_path: str, filename_path_to_save: str)¶

Method that creates a new project from an archetype. :param filename: Path where we want to save the project. :param archetype: Archetype type.

classmethod load_document_archetypes(folder=WindowsPath('C:/Users/Pablo Rivera Jimenez/Desktop/PROTEUS/Proteus TFG/archetypes')) → dict¶

Method that loads the document archetypes. The reason why a dict with key value is retun, where the key is the name of the document folder, is because you need to know which document it is, if you don’t use a dict and if you use a list you would need to iterate through all its values. :returns: A dict of document folder name and DocumentArchetypeProxy objects. :rtype: dict[str, DocumentArchetypeProxy]

classmethod load_object_archetypes(folder=WindowsPath('C:/Users/Pablo Rivera Jimenez/Desktop/PROTEUS/Proteus TFG/archetypes')) → dict¶

Method that loads the object archetypes. The reason why a dict with key value is retun, where the key is the name of the subdir folder name, is because you need to know which object it is, if you don’t use a dict and if you use a list you would need to iterate through all its values. :returns: A dict with the subdir name and the ObjectArchetypeProxy objects. :rtype: dict[str, ObjectArchetypeProxy]

classmethod load_project_archetypes(folder=WindowsPath('C:/Users/Pablo Rivera Jimenez/Desktop/PROTEUS/Proteus TFG/archetypes')) → dict¶

Method that loads the project archetypes. The reason why a dict with key value is retun, where the key is the name of the project folder, is because you need to know which project it is, if you don’t use a dict and if you use a list you would need to iterate through all its values. :returns: A dict of project folder name and ProjectArchetypeProxy objects. :rtype: dict[str, ProjectArchetypeProxy]

class proteus.model.archetype_manager.ArchetypesType¶

Enumeration for archetypes’ types. The values are the names of the subdirectories in the archetypes folder.

This values are: #. projects #. documents #. objects

Proxy class for managing PROTEUS project archetypes.

get_project() → Project¶

It returns an instance of a project. :returns: Instance of a Project. :rtype: project.Project

A PROTEUS object.

class proteus.model.object.Object(project: Project, object_file_path: str)¶

A PROTEUS object is an XML file inside of a PROTEUS project ‘objects’ directory.

A PROTEUS object can only be created by cloning another existing object, usually an archetype object.

An already created object can be loaded by providing the path to its XML file.

clone_object(parent: Union[Object, Project])¶

Function that clones an object in a new parent. This function doesn’t save the object in the system but add it to the parent children so it will be saved when we save the project.

Parameters:

parent (Union[Object,Project].) – Parent of the new object.

generate_xml() → Element¶

It generates an XML element for the object.

Returns:

XML element for the object.

Return type:

ET.Element

generate_xml_to_XSLT() → Element¶

It generates an XML element for the document. It’s a must to create an special ET.Element for XSLT because it’s not possible to use document() function from the XSLT file using the path of the object file due to the XSLT processor.

Returns:

XML element for the object.

Return type:

ET.Element

static load(project: Project, id: ProteusID) → Object¶

Static factory method for loading a PROTEUS object given a project and a short UUID.

Parameters:

  • project (Project) – Project object where the object is located.

  • id (ProteusID) – UUID of the project.

Returns:

Object object.

load_children(root: Element) → None¶

It loads a PROTEUS object’s children from an XML root element.

Parameters:

root (ET.Element) – XML root element.

class proteus.model.object.Project(path)¶

A PROTEUS project.

class proteus.model.project.Project(project_file_path: str)¶

A PROTEUS project is a ‘proteus.xml’ file inside a directory with ‘objects’ and ‘assets’ directories. The ‘proteus.xml’ must describe the projects properties and the short UUIDs of their documents (which are PROTEUS objects of with class tag ‘:Proteus-Document’.

A PROTEUS project can only be created by cloning another existing project, usually an archetype project.

An already created project can be loaded by providing the path to its directory.

generate_xml() → Element¶

It generates an XML element for the project.

Returns:

an XML element for the project.

Return type:

ET.Element

static load(path: str) → Project¶

Static factory method for loading a PROTEUS project from a given path.

Parameters:

path – path to the project file.

Returns:

a PROTEUS project.

load_documents(root: Element) → None¶

It loads a PROTEUS project’s documents from an XML root element.

Parameters:

root (ET.Element) – XML root element.

save_project() → None¶

It saves a project in the system.

PROTEUS properties.

class proteus.model.property.ClassListProperty(name: str = 'unnamed', category: str = 'general', value: Any = '')¶

Class for PROTEUS class-tag-list properties.

generate_xml_value(property_element: _Element) → str | lxml.etree.CDATA¶

It generates the value of the property for its XML element. In this case, it adds one <class> child for each class tag.

get_class_list() → list[str]¶

It generates a list of strings from the space-separated string with the class names. :return: list of strings with the class names.

class proteus.model.property.EnumProperty(name: str = 'unnamed', category: str = 'general', value: Any = '', choices: str = '')¶

Class for PROTEUS enumerated properties.

generate_xml_value(property_element: _Element) → str | lxml.etree.CDATA¶

It generates the value of the property for its XML element and the list of choices as the ‘choices’ attribute of the XML element.

get_choices_as_set() → set[str]¶

It generates a set of strings from the space-separated string with the enumerated choices. :return: set of strings with the enumerated choices.

class proteus.model.property.MarkdownProperty(name: str = 'unnamed', category: str = 'general', value: Any = '')¶

Class for PROTEUS markdown properties. They are exactly the same as string properties except for the XML tag.

class proteus.model.property.Property(name: str = 'unnamed', category: str = 'general', value: Any = '')¶

Abstract class for PROTEUS properties.

clone(new_value=None) → Property¶

It clones the property with a new value if it is not None. The new value must be provided as a string.

Parameters:

new_value – new value for the property.

ReturnS:

a copy of the property with the new value.

generate_xml() → _Element¶

This template method generates the XML element for the property.

Returns:

the XML element for the property.

Return type:

lxml.etree._Element

abstract generate_xml_value(_: Optional[_Element] = None) → str | lxml.etree.CDATA¶

It generates the value of the property for its XML element. Depending on the type of property, it can be a string or a CDATA section.
